DataElement.preferredName: Eyebrow Collection At Patient Visit And HPV Testing Patient Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for whether the participant agrees that their eyebrow hairs can be collected at Study Visits and they may be used for detecting HPV.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Eyebrow Collection At Patient Visit And Human Papillomavirus Testing  Patient Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Used to indicate position, location, or state._A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A strain of papillomavirus that can infect the skin and mucous membranes of humans._A procedure for critical evaluation._The arched strip of hair on the bony ridge above each eye socket._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.
A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the participant agree to
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the participant agree to have samples of their eyebrow hairs collected at the indicated study visits and agree that they may be used for detecting HPV in their body?
